guilab

Class Characters

  • java.lang.Object
    • guilab.Characters

  • public class Characters
extends java.lang.Object

    The Class Characters is responsible for loading available_players.txt and saving each line/player within the currentRoster ArrayList.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> availableToons 
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> currentRoster 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Characters()
      This is the default constructor for the Characters Class.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String addToCurrentRoster(int toon)
      This is a Setter-like method for adding a toon to our currentRoster Array.
      java.lang.String getName(int toon)
      This method returns the desired toon/characters name.
      int getSelectedPlayersCount()
      This method returns the player's current team size by assuming their are 10 total players.
      int getUnselectedPlayersCount()
      This method returns the number of unselected characters, by assuming their are 10 total players.
      java.lang.String removeFromCurrentRoster(int toon)
      This is a Setter-like method for removing a toon from our currentRoster Array.

    • Field Detail

      • availableToons

        private final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> availableToons

      • currentRoster

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> currentRoster

    • Constructor Detail

      • Characters

        public Characters()

        This is the default constructor for the Characters Class. It will try to open up our available_players.txt (Throwing an exception if the file is not found), and then proceed to read through the .txt line by line adding each name to availableToons ArrayList

    • Method Detail

      • addToCurrentRoster

        public java.lang.String addToCurrentRoster(int toon)

        This is a Setter-like method for adding a toon to our currentRoster Array. Afterwards, it utilizes a enhanced for loop for for "re-building" our new roster to return.

        Parameters:
        toon - The toon/character we wish to add to our team's currentRoster.
        Returns:
        The new currentRoster in a String format.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName(int toon)

        This method returns the desired toon/characters name.

        Parameters:
        toon - The number identifying which toon/character we wish to add to our team's currentRoster.
        Returns:
        The desired toon/characters name.

      • getSelectedPlayersCount

        public int getSelectedPlayersCount()

        This method returns the player's current team size by assuming their are 10 total players.

        Returns:
        The player's current team size.

      • getUnselectedPlayersCount

        public int getUnselectedPlayersCount()

        This method returns the number of unselected characters, by assuming their are 10 total players.

        Returns:
        The number of unselected toons/characters

      • removeFromCurrentRoster

        public java.lang.String removeFromCurrentRoster(int toon)

        This is a Setter-like method for removing a toon from our currentRoster Array. Afterwards, it utilizes a enhanced for loop for for "re-building" our new roster to return.

        Parameters:
        toon - The toon/character we wish to remove from our team's currentRoster
        Returns:
        The new currentRoster in a String format.
